text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits new IRM

, Information and Whistleblower Awards, Guidance for SB/SE Initial Claim Evaluation (ICE) Team. contains information needed by Small Business Self Employed (SB/SE) Division, Ogden Campus Exam/Automated Underreporter (AUR), SB/SE ICE Team personnel for processing Form

This IRM section provides guidance for all SB/SE Initial Claim Evaluation (ICE) Unit personnel to follow when processing Form 211, Application for Award for Original Information, and/or processing any submitted information related to allegations and dealing with whistleblower’s claims for award.
SB/SE ICE Team personnel in Ogden Campus Exam/AUR processing Form 211 claims.

Background
Authority
Roles and Responsibilities

Program Controls

for SB/SE Initial Claim Evaluation (ICE) 25.2.10 page 1
SB/SE Initial Claim Evaluation (ICE) page (

) This IRM outlines the policy and procedures for SB/SE Initial Claim (ICE) unit personnel when processing whistleblower claims for award and be strictly adhered to. Any deviation from this IRM must be approved by the Small Business/Self-Employed (SB/SE) Exam Headquarters - Field and Campus Policy, SB/SE Ogden Campus Exam/AUR, and the Whistleblower Office (WO). (
) Purpose: This IRM section provides procedures for processing the Form Application for Award for Original Information, known as a whistleblower on behalf of the Whistleblower Office (WO). (
) Audience: SB/SE ICE Personnel considering, working, receiving, or assigned a whistleblower claim. (
) Policy Owner: The WO has strategy, policy, administration, oversight, and reporting responsibility for the IRS’s Whistleblower Program. (
) Program Owner: SB/SE Ogden Campus Exam/AUR. (

) Primary Stakeholders: The SB/SE ICE Team personnel, SB/SE Ogden Campus Exam/AUR, SB/SE Exam Headquarters - Field and Campus Policy, WO, and ALL other Operating Divisions and Functions impacted by these cedures. Stakeholders can provide input to the procedures and effects may include a change in work ﬂow, additional duties, change in established time frames, or similar issues. (

) Program Goals: This guidance is provided to describe a variety of miscella- neous procedures performed by the ICE Unit to assist the WO with evaluating, researching, monitoring, paying, and closing whistleblower By following the procedures in this IRM, users will be able to accurately and timely process Form

claims. The whistleblower claim is input in the system and inventory is controlled within the e-Trak system. Reports should run using the e-Trak system, at the various processing stages, to validate frames and program goals are on target. (
) The Tax Relief and Health Care Act of
(TRHCA
) added IRC §
(b), which enacted signiﬁcant changes in the IRS award program for whistleblowers. (
) The law requires the WO to analyze a whistleblower’s claim information submitted under IRC §
(b), and either investigate the matter or assign it the appropriate IRS office. (
) Operating at the direction of the Commissioner of the IRS, the WO with other IRS units, analyzes information submitted, and makes award minations. (
) The procedures contained in this IRM provide guidance and include other resources available for the SB/SE ICE Team employees to process Form

claims on behalf of the WO program. The direction to analyze, research, tigate, assign, and/or coordinate with other IRS operating divisions or supports both the goals and objectives of the SB/SE Division and WO.
Policy Owner: The WO has strategy, policy, administration, oversight, and reporting responsibility for the IRS’s Whistleblower Program.

for als who provide information to the IRS related to the detection of underpayments of tax, or to the detection and bringing to trial and punishment of persons guilty of violating the internal revenue laws or conniving at the same is delegated to the Director of the WO under Delegation Order

claim process. Items sent to the SB/SE ICE Team are considered sent to the WO. The ﬁnal approval of procedure is completed by the WO to ensure the procedures conform and support the intent of the WO policies and changes and updates to tax laws. This includes any local desk procedural guides, procedures and policy alerts, and new IRM revisions. (

) IRM deviation procedures: a. Service Center Directors, Headquarter Directors, Headquarter Analysts, and Campus managers/employees do not have the authority to approve deviations from IRM procedures. Any request for an exception or deviation to an IRM procedure must be elevated through appropriate channels for executive and WO approval. This will ensure other func- tional areas are not adversely affected by the change, and it does not result in disparate treatment of whistleblowers or taxpayers. b. See speciﬁc guidelines in IRM
Internal Management Documents System, Internal Revenue Manual (IRM) Process. Requests for an IRM deviation must be submitted in writing and signed, following instructions from IRM

). Any disclosure issues will be coordinated by the Program Owner. No deviations can begin until reviewed by the Policy and Program Owners and approved at the Executive Level, with ﬁnal approval by the WO. All requests must be submitted to the SB/SE Exam Headquarters - Field and Campus Policy IRM Coordinator. (

from receipt to determination. (

) The WO has strategy, policy, administration, oversight, review, and reporting responsibility for the IRS’s Whistleblower Program. In this capacity, the WO ensures the service wide handling of whistleblower claims is consistent with relevant laws, regulations, policies, and the direction of the IRS Whistleblower Program. Further, all matters that impact the Whistleblower Program, audits or other inquiries from GAO, TIGTA, Congressional Committees, TAS, stakeholder groups, news media, or others will be overseen by the WO. The WO will involve SB/SE at the onset and throughout all aspects of such that relate to the ICE unit. a. The WO is responsible to review procedures and guidance developed SB/SE Exam Headquarters - Field and Campus Policy and provide feedback and ﬁnal approval of such procedures and guidance within Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

The WO has strategy, policy, administration, oversight, review, and reporting responsibility for the IRS’s Whistleblower Program. In this capacity, the WO ensures the service wide handling of whistleblower claims is consistent with relevant laws, regulations, policies, and the direction of the IRS Whistleblower Program. Further, all matters that impact the Whistleblower Program, including audits or other inquiries from GAO, TIGTA, Congressional Committees, TAS, stakeholder groups, news media, or others will be overseen by the WO. The WO will involve SB/SE at the onset and throughout all aspects of such matters that relate to the ICE unit.
The WO is responsible to review procedures and guidance developed by SB/SE Exam Headquarters
Field and Campus Policy and provide feedback and ﬁnal approval of such procedures and guidance within

seven days or agreed time frame to support activities following the proce- dures in this IRM. SB/SE Exam Headquarters - Field and Campus Policy supports responses and actions to address Form 211 allegations as well as other qualifying whistleblower submissions and oversees the intent of

The SB/SE Division has operational responsibility for the SB/SE ICE Team. In this capacity, SB/SE will ensure that the SB/SE ICE Team resources are used efficiently and effectively. SB/SE will determine the staff levels needed to deliver the Whistleblower Program expectations.

The SB/SE Division has operational responsibility for the SB/SE ICE Team. In this capacity, SB/SE will ensure that the SB/SE ICE Team resources are used efficiently and effectively. SB/SE will determine the staff levels needed to deliver the Whistleblower Program expectations.

As SB/SE identiﬁes potential whistleblower claim process changes to improve quality, efficiency, and/or effectiveness of whistleblower claim processing, SB/SE will collaborate with WO as deemed applicable. SB/SE will provide written notice of all procedural changes to the WO seven days prior to implementation. The WO will respond to SB/SE within seven days to accept the change or state where the proposed changes are not consistent with policy, strategy, or legal requirements and are not to be implemented. SB/SE Exam Headquarters - Field and Campus Policy supports responses and actions taken to address Form
claims and oversees the intent of the WO policies and updates to law.
law. (

) The Director, SB/SE Exam Headquarters - Field and Campus Policy, is sible for all policy and procedures related to the guidance for SB/SE Ogden Campus Exam/AUR, SB/SE ICE Team. SB/SE Exam Headquarters - Field Campus Policy is responsible for overseeing program coordination for dures related to the WO program. SB/SE Exam Headquarters - Field and Campus Policy works closely with the Director and Operations Manager, SB/SE Ogden Campus Exam/AUR, Planning and Analysis (P & A), SB/SE Ogden Campus Exam/AUR, Whistleblower Office, and ALL other operating divisions and functions. SB/SE Field and Campus Policy supports and actions to Form
claims and oversees the intent of the WO policies and updates to tax law. (

) The Director, SB/SE Ogden Campus Exam/AUR is responsible to support tivities following the procedures in this IRM. The SB/SE Ogden Campus AUR Director oversees planning and analysis, operation, department, team and employee responses and actions to Form
claims. (

) The Planning & Analysis (P & A) Manager, SB/SE Ogden Campus is responsible to support activities following the procedures in this IRM. Ogden Campus Exam/AUR P & A oversees and supports the direction of operation, department, team and employee responses and actions to Form claims. (

) The Operations Manager, SB/SE Ogden Campus Exam/AUR is responsible oversee activities following the procedures in this IRM. The SB/SE Ogden Campus Exam/AUR Operations Manager oversees department, team, and employee responses and actions to Form
claims. (

claims.
Information and Whistleblower

) The SB/SE Ogden Campus ICE team manager is responsible to manage employee activities following the procedures in this IRM. The SB/SE Ogden Campus ICE team manager oversees employee responses and actions to Form
claims. (
) The employees are responsible for completing activities following the proce- dures in this IRM. The SB/SE Ogden Campus ICE team employees provide responses and complete actions to Form
claims. (

) The SB/SE ICE Team roles and responsibilities are framed around the multiple steps of the whistleblower claim process. The following actions are performed by the SB/SE ICE Team employees. The list is not intended to all-inclusive of every process or duty performed by the SB/SE ICE Team. Timely action is essential for all of these responsibilities.

Action Performed Role/Responsibility Initial Review and Routing • Receipt, control, and processing of mail related to whistleblowers. • Reviewing Forms 211 for basic complete- ness. • Scanning all Forms 211. • Scanning electronic media for viruses and copying data on CDs. • Performing research and establishing cases in e-Trak. • Processing Power of Attorney (POA) (Forms 2848) under WO Program procedures. • Routing of claims to Classiﬁcation. • Coordination with Classiﬁcation. • Issuing acknowledgement / rejection / denial letters. Post SB/SE and Other Operating Divisions Classi- • Routing of claims to Case Development and ﬁcation Oversight (CDO), SB/SE Specialty Classiﬁ- cation, other Operating Division (OD) Classiﬁcation, or Criminal Investigation. • Establishing AIMS controls (SB/SE claims) and input of ICE indicators (all OD claims). • Routing of claims to PSP Coordinators (SB/SE claims) Subject Matter Experts (Other OD claims). • Preparing case ﬁles for claims selected for examination. • Preparing, obtaining approval of, and issuing rejection / denial letters. • Updating e-Trak.

for basic complete- ness. Scanning all Forms

cation, other Operating Division (OD) Classiﬁcation, or Criminal Investigation. Establishing AIMS controls (SB/SE claims) and input of ICE indicators (all OD claims). Trak.
for SB/SE Initial Claim Evaluation (ICE) 25.2.10

25.2.10 page 5 Examination Investigation • Monitoring claims in the ﬁeld. • Adding ICE Indicators to expanded years and related modules. • Issuing rejection / denial letters. • Initial review of Forms 11369 received from the ﬁeld for IRC§7623(a) claims for comple- tion. • Routing of Forms 11369 to Award Recom- mendation and Coordination (ARC) and Case Development and Oversight (CDO) within the WO for review and approval to update the ICE indicator. • Update the ICE indicator based on ARC or CDO instructions. • Processing cases after ARC action. • Processing suspended cases . • Updating e-Trak. Waiting Period • Monitoring Refund Statute Expiration Date (RSED). • Monitoring accounts for collected proceeds. • Updating e-Trak. Award Determination • Preparation of award calculation worksheet for IRC§7623(a) claims. • Preparation of calculation worksheet as ap- plicable. • Reviewing and documenting whistleblower tax ﬁling compliance. • Forwarding award package to ARC for review and approval. • Issuing denial letters for ARC and CDO when claims are: surveyed, no changed, no adjustments attributable to the whistle- blower, or no collected proceeds. • Updating e-Trak. Award Payment • Contacting Corporate Performance and Budget and Budget Execution Offices re- questing funds to pay IRC§7623(a) and IRC§7623(b) awards that have been approved by the WO. • Preparing accounting memos and forms for award payments. • Sending accounting memos to the WO for approval. • Routing award payment packages to Ac- counting. • Closing cases in e-Trak.
Preparation of award calculation worksheet for IRC§

(a) claims. Preparation of calculation worksheet as ap- plicable. Reviewing and documenting whistleblower tax ﬁling compliance. Forwarding award package to ARC for review and approval. Issuing denial letters for ARC and CDO when claims are: surveyed, no changed, no adjustments attributable to the whistle- blower, or no collected proceeds. Updating e-Trak. Contacting Corporate Performance and Budget and Budget Execution Offices re- questing funds to pay IRC§
(a) and IRC§
(b) awards that have been approved by the WO. Preparing accounting memos and forms for award payments. Sending accounting memos to the WO for approval. Routing award payment packages to Ac- counting.
Information and Whistleblower Awards

• Responding to general whistleblower related correspondence, emails, and phone calls. • Provide WO senior leadership with weekly inventory reports by each Wednesday for the preceding week. • Monthly reconciliation between the ICE award recordation spreadsheet, individual award calculation spreadsheet from e-Trak records, and the accounting records within seven calendar days of month end. • End of ﬁscal year reconciliation between the ICE award recordation spreadsheet, indi- vidual award calculation spreadsheet from e-Trak records, and the accounting records before October

th. • Tracking of all whistleblower awards paid and reporting data to the WO for its ﬁscal year Annual Report to Congress. Fiscal year awards paid data must be certiﬁed for accuracy by ICE and Ogden SB/SE man- agement prior to forwarding to the WO. • End of calendar year reconciliation between the ICE award recordation spreadsheet, in- dividual award calculation spreadsheet from e-Trak records, and the accounting records. • Providing WO with data for preparation of calendar year Forms
-MISC. Before January
of each year (or by the Friday before, if January
falls on a weekend), providing ﬁnal Form
-MISC listing, with- holding account transcript, and applicable ICE award recordation spreadsheets to WO for preparation of Form
ICE unit Lead and Manager must certify Form

-MISC data is accurate prior to forwarding to the WO. • Reviewing ACIS (AIMS Centralized Informa- tion System) reports for discrepancies and making required corrections. • Mailing litigation case documents to the WO headquarters. • Filing closed cases. • Shipping documents to the Federal Records Center. • Supporting efforts to improve communica- tions with whistleblowers.
Program Reviews: Headquarter Policy, Operational, and program reviews are conducted to ensure that actions are in accordance with the procedures in this
for SB/SE Initial Claim Evaluation (ICE) 25.2.10 page
page (

) Program Reports: The following daily, weekly, and monthly reports are generated by management, P & A, and/or the WO, and can assist with evalu- ating the performance of the SB/SE ICE Team program. • ICE Employee Daily Reports • ICE Team Overage Listing Reports • ICE Weekly Reports • ICE Weekly Dashboard Reports • ICE Monthly Reports • Embedded Quality Review System (EQRS) Reports • WO Quality Review Reports • Week At A Glance (WAAG) Reports • Work Planning & Control (WP&C) Reports (
) Program Effectiveness - Results: The program report results and data are housed on the SB/SE Ogden Campus Exam/AUR Shar
oint site in the P & ICE Weekly-Dashboard Data and Reports folder. The reports provide daily, weekly, monthly, and cumulative data. (

) Program Effectiveness - Quality: Evaluative EQRS reviews and Whistle- blower Office Quality Review reports are consistency reviews routinely conducted, along with Headquarter Policy reviews to ensure whistleblower claim actions are timely and in accordance with the procedures in this IRM. a. Claim reviews using EQRS are conducted by the SB/SE ICE Team manager to ensure compliance with this IRM. b. Operational reviews are conducted by the Department and Operation Managers and P & A annually to evaluate program delivery, to administrative requirements and ensure compliance with this IRM. c. SB/SE Headquarters - Exam Field and Campus Policy, will conduct yearly program reviews, as necessary, to verify compliance with IRM re- quirements, address TIGTA/GAO ﬁndings, and address any trends that appear, missing steps, and/or clariﬁcations. d. WO Quality Review, will conduct claim reviews to ensure the SB/SE Team is in compliance with this IRM. WO Quality Review will deliver the results and ﬁndings to the SB/SE Ogden Campus Exam/AUR. (
) The program control system used to oversee and manage the inventory is e-Trak system. The e-Trak system has a log-in program control to limit to its content. (
) The submission of Form
claims are built and loaded in the e-Trak system and becomes the inventory assigned to SB/SE ICE Team employees. (

) The e-Trak system tracks the various actions taken by SB/SE ICE employees to manage the multiple stages of whistleblower claim inventory. The whistle- blower claims inventory and actions are monitored by SB/SE Ogden Campus Operation, Department, and Front-Line managers along with SB/SE ICE employees, P & A, and WO. (

) The SB/SE ICE Team employees should ensure actions taken meet the pro- cessing criteria outlined in the current IRM resources found on local IRM and/or local desk procedural guides located on the local ICE Shar
oint site.
Reports: The following daily, weekly, and monthly reports are by management, P & A, and/or the WO, and can assist with the performance of the SB/SE ICE Team program.

oint site. (
